qas.question: Who is the Governor in Michigan?
On which date did Detroit file bankruptcy?
How much debt did Detroit have when they declared bankruptcy?
On which date was Detroit's bankruptcy plan approved?
What type of bankruptcy did Detroit go through?

context: The Governor of Michigan, <a0_0>Rick Snyder<a0_0/>, declared a financial emergency for the city in March 2013, appointing an emergency manager. On <a1_0>July 18, 2013<a1_0/>, Detroit filed the largest municipal bankruptcy case in U.S. history. It was declared bankrupt by Judge Steven W. Rhodes of the Bankruptcy Court for the Eastern District of Michigan on December 3, 2013; he cited its <a2_0>$18.5 billion<a2_0/> debt and declared that negotiations with its thousands of creditors were unfeasible. On <a3_0>November 7, 2014<a3_0/>, Judge Rhodes approved the city's bankruptcy plan, allowing the city to begin the process of exiting bankruptcy. The City of Detroit successfully exited <a4_0>Chapter 9<a4_0/> municipal bankruptcy with all finances handed back to the city at midnight on December 11, 2014.
